intro: Dioscorea daunea, commonly known as the Daune yam, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Dioscoreaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are often used in traditional medicine. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers and has compound leaves with three to five leaflets. Its tubers are similar in appearance to other yam species but are less commonly cultivated for food. The botanical features of Dioscorea daunea make it an important plant in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
